enrolled_courses.title: Object Oriented Programming
enrolled_courses.description:
This course provides a comprehensive introduction to Object-Oriented Programming, a fundamental programming paradigm widely used in modern software development. Students will learn how to design and build modular, reusable, and scalable software using core OOP concepts such as classes, objects, inheritance, encapsulation, polymorphism, and abstraction.

Through hands-on projects and real-world examples, learners will gain practical experience implementing OOP in languages like Python, Java, or C++. By the end of the course, students will be able to structure code effectively, solve complex problems using OOP principles, and develop maintainable applications.

Topics Covered:

Introduction to Classes and Objects

Constructors and Destructors

Encapsulation and Data Hiding

Inheritance and Code Reusability

Polymorphism and Method Overriding

Abstraction and Interface Design

Composition vs. Inheritance

Designing OOP-based Applications

Prerequisites: Basic knowledge of programming fundamentals.
